Reviews.Title: “Not a "vacation" hotel, but otherwise satisfied”
Reviews.Author: itzMS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is at 51st Street directly off of I-10. About a 5 minute drive to Maryvale for Spring Training...15-20 minutes for downtown, golf & other stadiums. Pretty easy to get to/from the airport from here. Keep in mind, this is not a hotel to stay at if you like to hang out at the hotel. The rooms were nicely remodeled and were fine for sleeping. Just come with the realization that there is nothing else to do at the hotel or even within walking distance. While the service at the front desk was excellent, the service at the hotel lounge/bar was abysmal. It took 30-45 minutes to get a drink, the bartenders did not even know how to make basic drinks and they were out of several common things (including Grey Goose, amaretto, etc!) If you wanted anything other than a basic bottle of beer, good luck. This was really too bad as the lounge looks quite nice with TVs, a pool table and a dartboard. Most hotel guests will want to hang out in the bar/lounge...so I hope the Holiday Inn will seek improvements here.

Reviews.Title: “Fit our need perfectly”
Reviews.Author: isellfords
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn West Phoenix for 4 nights March 12-16, 2012. My son and I were in town to catch Spring training games. We booked through Hotwire. Overall, we were happy with the hotel. The room was clean, and the property seemed well cared for. I called ahead and reserved a room with 2 double beds, and they were glad to accomodate the request. Sounds like a small thing, but I've had issues with this in the past, especially if you've booked online. Location was ideal for us, close to the Highway and reasonable access to everywhere we wanted to go. My only suggestion would be to find a way to divert the flow of the A/C, it blows directly on the person who sleeps in the bed closest to the unit.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not bad”
Reviews.Author: JimgMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Phoenix on the west side to save some money. I don't know if it was worth it. I consider myself a hotel snob so take my review with a grain of salt. This Holiday Inn was updated and the rooms are nice. The air conditioning is the wall-based unit versus the automatic temp control. The exercise room is pathetic. There were only 5 dumbbells that looked like someone donated them from their house. They don't have a pantry where you can buy water, treats etc. They have vending machines. There is an in house bar and small restaurant. The food was bar food. I also found the parking spaces incredibly small. At least I was driving a rental but my travel partner always had to wait for me to back out before he could get in. The service was good, the staff friendly. I would not recommend this hotel for experienced business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business stay”
Reviews.Author: khut
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I was in Phoenix for business. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was conveniently located close to the express ways so I could get to places quickly. The room was clean and nice looking. The business center was good and easily accessible. I did not eat in the restaurant, so I can’t comment on that. The only issue that I had was that the only way to get to my room on the fourth floor was via the elevator. The stairs were for emergency use only and I would have preferred to use the stairs for quicker access.

Reviews.Title: “Booked the wrong hotel”
Reviews.Author: SharoninOK
Reviews.Content: It's on me as I meant to book the Holiday Inn Express West (Goodyear) but booked Holiday Inn Phoenix West. I was traveling with my recently graduated 23 year old son; helping him move from Golden, CO to his new job in Tucson, AZ. We stayed in room 321. This is my third stay at a Holiday Inn/Holiday Inn Express in seven days. The Good: The staff -- very helpful, very polite, very nice The location -- right off I-10, easy to locate The room -- fridge in room The Bad: The location -- right off I-10...could be noisy. I always ask for an upper floor and with the AC running, we had no problems even though we faced the highway One elevator -- plan to spend time waiting, and waiting, and waiting,.. Business Center -- saw one by the front desk; only one computer in a small room. One person on the computer and one standing by the door waiting. WiFi -- Never was able to connect. Spent the night at a HIE in NM the night before & had no problem. Stopped at another HIE during the day to make reservation for this night & had no trouble. I eventually signed on via the Red Rood Inn WiFi. Oddly enough, my son was finally able to connect to the WiFi after the front desk contacted corporate and corp re-set the system. (Again, very helpful at the front desk!) WiFi -- No option to purchase a secured service (as was offered at the HIE we stayed at in Bernalillo) so was limited in what I was able to accomplish via my son's computer. "Restaurant" -- Is in the bar which is dark and dated. Mediocre food at high prices. One person working behind the bar...who was taking care of everything, including room service. She was very nice but, due to only one person working, service was lacking. The hotel -- dated. It looks and feels like effort has been made to keep things up, and even improved, but sometimes cosmetic face-lifts only go so far. The room -- 90% clean: windows to outside balcony were dirty (looks like a dog's nose prints all over the window). Few outlets...the outlet on the desk lamp had the fridge plugged into it. Hate having to crawl under the desk to plug things in...I always travel with an extension cord and could have used another one. We had two computers, two phones, iPod, iPad, and a battery charger for my camera. We rotated items in order to charge them all. Our HIE in NM had more than enough outlets to handle our items. Mattresses, mattress covers, sheets all seem very new and were clean; no rips, stains, etc. (I always look but just can't bring myself to use a black light - would probably never sleep in a hotel again, lol). Nice blackout curtains on the windows too. Pillows looked new but were cheap foam, most already lumpy. Effort has been made to update the bathroom but it's still small compared to HI and HIE that have been built in the last few years. I'm a towel snob and these rank about 5 out of 10. They were clean (not thin and no stains) but small and rather cheap. Older TV but it worked well enough, don't expect flat screen. Newer phone. Used the iron & ironing board - clean. Seemed brand new; don't know if it was ever used before! Single cup coffee maker, good setup but didn't use. Free B'fast: None offered - but then again, I booked the wrong hotel so that is my issue. You can purchase b'fast in the bar/restaurant but after dinner there the night before, we grabbed a bite on the road. The location -- Not thrilled with what is, and isn't, in the area. Two fast food places nearby and other hotels. Not much else. Didn't seem anyone hanging around the area but it just doesn't have a good feel to it; I wouldn't go out here at night. Pool/Hot Tub -- Son used both; hot tub was about the same temp as pool. Both clean. Fitness room -- Per son: Some dumbbells, elliptical, stairmaster, and treadmill. All clean and in good repair, some pieces seemed to be rather new. The other thing I noticed immediately...upon checkin (and then waiting at the front desk area for about 50 minutes while working on WiFi issues)...not one woman checked in. Watched over 4 men check in. In the bar/restaurant for dinner, 5 men at the bar and then 6 other men came in to eat. Mind you, I had no issue with any of the men but it was odd that none had a wife/girlfriend, and no woman checking in alone. I also didn't see any families. Finally saw one woman while we were trying to exit the elevator to go to dinner...she just barged in without allow my son and I to exit. Neither of us got a positive feel from her based on her behavior, dress, and attitude. Just made you wonder... Son said he did see a mother and son check in and one teenage girl at the business center when he went down to the pool but still, very few woman and families. Not my cup of tea and not the place for families but I would recommend to the solo male business traveler who wants things rather simple.

Reviews.Title: “They are trying to improve, but have a long way to go.”
Reviews.Author: bixatthebeach
Reviews.Content: This hotel is supposed to be being renovated, but it does not appear to be moving very quickly. I found that the room was not well cleaned. The first thing I look at is the corners, along the baseboard. This area had accumulated dust and noticeable particles of dirt. The shower was not as clean as it should have been. Let's get rid of the old televisions. They desperately need a second elevator. I would remove the existing one and install a double bank of functional units. Glass walls are not required. The restaurant area appearance was very dated and needed to be completely remodeled. Painting baseboard that has been dented and damaged over many years does not qualify as renovation. Top set base would be a good alterative. Doors that are seriously beaten up should just be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Renovated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TryingOne
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here countless times over the past 15 years and the new ownership has made a solid committment to the hotel with the renovated rooms and with more to come I understand. Service great proving that its the people not the building.

Reviews.Title: “Pedophiles and marijuana smokers”
Reviews.Author: soccermom552
Reviews.Content: Traveled with young children 8/9 years old. Individual not staying at the hotel grabbed children, stared at them, and spoke suggestively to them. When the issue was addressed with the hotel staff, the individual was not removed from the hotel. On the last night of the stay, multiple individuals were openly smoking marijuana in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “In the slums”
Reviews.Author: janelle99
Reviews.Content: We arrived there was a homeless person outside peeing on the sidewalk...the room was not ready...the lobby smelled of lysol ...the carpet was dirty and stained...the room smelled and had sticky bathroom floors with shoe prints on it...the room was facing the highway and was very noisy...there were workmen on manlifts so we kept curtains closed...on wednesday we went out for the day and came back to find that neither of our cards worked in the door...the front desk person was really slow and rude about it...the bar in the hotel looked like something out of the old west smelly ,,,dirty,,,our room was never vacumed and we were there Monday - Friday...and there was never any place to park..never again Holiday Inn

Reviews.Title: “Charged extra $188 and guest relations advised they cannot resolve the issue”
Reviews.Author: elv1421
Reviews.Content: Beware staying here if you book & prepay ahead of time. We were charged $188 after the room had been paid for. Upon trying to contact the hotel directly they phone just rang continuously on several occasions and no one ever picked up. I then contacted Holiday Inn guest relations (not for the specific hotel but the generic online customer care), who first advised that I would be contacted by the above hotel directly within 48 hours. They never contacted me. Then after 2 weeks of emailing back and forth with guest relations, they advised that they could not resolve it and to contact my credit card company. Meanwhile, no one can tell me what the $188 was charged for, we stayed there only 2 nights and actually paid for 3 because we thought we would be there longer. So, this $188 dollars is on top of them getting the money from an extra night already. If you have to stay somewhere in the area I recommend ANYWHERE but the Holiday Inn as if you are overcharged you will never see that money again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: SMAZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to go to Spring Training B-Ball. The hotel is right off I-10, so you are close to all the fields. The rooms are in the process of being renovated. My buddy got one with new carpet , but mine was the old style. I would suggest that you try to get a room on the 4th floor. The traffic noise is pretty loud, but i left the fan going and it drowned everything out. These are not the best rooms i've ever seen, but they are comfortable and the staff is friendly. Got ours for sixty a night, so you can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice price”
Reviews.Author: nafpgh
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was about 10 minutes from the University of Phoenix Stadium. We had a King room on the third floor. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was friendly. There was a Micro/Frig and wireless internet. There was a balcony that you could stand on, but the view was of a busy street. There was a little traffice noise but the mild humming of the airconditioner covered it and it did not prevent us from getting a good night's rest. There are alot of places to eat in the area and a Walmart about 2 miles away. We had no problems with this hotel and would stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to rest”
Reviews.Author: Austinite46
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to spend the night on our road trip from Austin to Los Angeles. We found the room to be spacious and very clean. The pillow menu was a very nice touch. The staff was courteous and very helpful. The customer service we received from Lupita and Anna in the restaurant as we had breakfast was honestly some of the very best we've received EVER. The area was clean and well lit and we had no reservations going across the street to the grocery store,. to the gas station on the corner or out to our car during the night. I have issues with the cost of room service and movie rental at every hotel I stay in, but we would return to this hotel on any of our return trips.

Reviews.Title: “not a typical holiday inn....stay away”
Reviews.Author: sandiegolarmar
Reviews.Content: It was the last night of our 10 day vacation so we opted to stay in Phoenix and choose this hotel because we were told it had just been remodeled....if so then they should not have spent the money. And had we known it was in the conidition we found it in we certainly would not have spent the money to stay there We paid for a whirlpool tub....which was clean but pulling away from the wall and the faucet for the shower dripped, the carpet was filthy and there was a tear in it in the bedroom. The baseboard looked as though they had never been cleaned. The closet had no door on it, the painted cabinets in the kitchen area were peeling as was the wall paper. You could not open the frig as the door drug on the floor, we were told it had a lovely balcony which it did not, the view was the cement panel, except if you looked over it you could see the freeway, but there was only room to stand thus no furniture. The resturant was not open and the lounge was very small. The area is not the best either and we did not feel safe nor did we feel our car was safe. We did not see a security guard anywhere. The staff was very friendly but can not make up for something that is not there. 2 other couples were complaining when we checked out. We did not mention our problems as we are priority club members and opted to write directly to the corporate headquarters. A very disappointing stay to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Pattidh
Reviews.Content: I came into phoenix on March 4th and arrived at 3:30 am our flight was very late. The girl at the desk Myra was very nice to us-she saw that we were tired and she did fast service for us. We hadn't eaten anything since early am and she gave us her sandwich she had for dinner-she was wonderful. If you are looking for a 5 star this is not but it is a nice place. The pool however is not outside which i was disappointed because we do not see much sun in NY and i was looking forward to this. However, the service was great and the staff was great also. The rooms were very clean and nice. They cleaned every day we wanted them to come in. We did not have any loud noise next door and it was nice. The girl in the restaurant(both ladies) in the am were great to us and the food was great also.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms, great price!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDoubleJ
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotwire and were a bit skeptical when we got a 3* hotel for $45/night, but can honestly say that was the best hotel experience we've had when booking online. The woman checking in before us paid $179 for the one night, and we paid less than that for all 3 nights! The hotel is a bit older, but the rooms are comfortable and roomy. It's located right off the freeway and is within 10-15 minutes of wherever you want to go whether it's downtown Phoenix, the University of Phoenix Stadium, the US Airways Center, or their great shopping centers. The first night we were there, the fire alarm went off about 3:50 am. The staff moved quickly and found that someone accidentally pulled the alarm and there indeed was not a fire. We returned to our rooms and went back to sleep. The next day, we asked for directions to a restaurant and instead of simply pointing us in the right direction, the girl at the front desk printed out a Google Map for us with detailed directions. That was unexpected but much appreciated since we had never been to Phoenix and weren't that familiar with the area yet. We did not try the hotel restaurant or bar, but we rarely do in hotels. I would highly recommend this hotel for the price conscientious traveler that can't afford a fancy hotel but wants to feel safe and comfortable at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “An anchor!”
Reviews.Author: exsausd
Reviews.Content: After being stranded in Phoenix by U.S. Air at 11:30 PM and needing a place to stay before driving to Palm Springs my wife and I drove past the Holiday Inn and thought it looked fine for a very needed nights sleep after being subjected to U.S. Airways incompetancy for about 6 hours. Walked in without reservations and was greeted by a friendly desk person who said a double bedded non smoking room was available for 99.00. I was so tired that I would have paid twice that for a bed. The room was quiet, clean, and spacious. Had a great night sleep with choice of 3 types of pillows on a comfortable mattress. What more is there to say? I would not hesitate in staying there again, but hopefully under better circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great if your used to staying in a crackhouse”
Reviews.Author: tucsoncop
Reviews.Content: Although I booked this room on hotwire and thought I was getting a great deal, I was surely disappointed after arriving. I called the hotel 2 weeks prior to my booking to request a non-smoking King room. The gentleman who answered the phone was more than happy to satisfy my request. When my wife and I arrived, we were less than impressed by the surrounding area. Although there was an on-site security guard in the parking lot, he seemed distracted and was sleeping near the front door. Shame on him as there was a car filled with gang members cruising throught the parking lot, looking for an available victim. Upon checking in, the desk agent asked me, "So, I have you down for a non-smoking king." I replied in the affirmative and after about 15 seconds of looking through her computer, the desk agent said to me, "Is a non-smoking double okay?" I told her that I had previously called to request a king and she told me, "You booked on hotwire and nothing is guaranteed." I told her, "I guess I have to take what you have." She rudely pushed me 2 room keys and my wife and I made our way up to our room. Upon entering the room, my wife expressed, "What is that smell? The room trully smelled like a senior nursing home. It smelled like a colostomy bag exploded. We immediately called the front desk and we were told we would get another room. My wife again inquired if there were any king rooms available. We were informed that the only king's available were smoking rooms. Hindsight is 20/20, but I should have taken it. Upon entering our 2nd double room, it smelled just as bad and it appeared as if the carpeting hadn't been vacuumed with trash and crumbs all over the floor. The bedspreads were circa 1978 and appeared dirty and unkept. The towels in the bathroom were paper thin. Come on, does it take much to stock the place with new towels. This isn't the Motel 6 and I would expect a little more from a chain like the Holiday Inn, especially their flagship brand. Furthermore, the drapery was ripped, the television had basic cable channels and the bathroom fixtures appeared old and unkept. At one point, my wife needed to go to the car for something and I actually said that I would escort her for the first time in our 7 years of knowing eachother. When I finally tried going to sleep, it was impossible. The smell permeated the room, my feet were hanging off the bed (doubles, come on I'm 6'2,) and I couldn't get the curtains to hide the light from the bright lights outside in the parking lot. This hotel was absolutely horrible. The staff was less than helpful and when I checked prices on their website, I found that I only saved myself 5 bucks by using Hotwire. Not worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: goodfriendSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last night and I got in very very late and I was met with the most friendly person I've have met at a hotel. She was so helpful I had a bad flight and had to get up early for my meeting I told her that i had to get up at 6am so instead of just setting one of those wake up calls she actually called me to wish me a good morning and ask me if she could have some breakfast brought to my room just to try to start my day off right. I told her no I would just get some coffee. in about 10 minutes she came to my door with a togo cup of coffee and said she wanted me to start my day out right. you have no idea how at home I felt. ofilea went above a beyond for some one that only has stayed there once I will always go back to that hotel and will tell everyone in the world to try it too. she was not the only one there that was great everyone i ran into treated me the same way. i would love to have all my employees to stay here to experiance what great service is

Reviews.Title: “Horrifying Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurotour78
Reviews.Content: The worst smelling hotel I have ever had the misfortune of stepping into. It is a torture chamber for non smokers. We lasted five minutes, giving up our prepaid Hotwire booking and fled. Additionally, all the public areas were dirty and looked like they had not been cleaned in years. Scary neighborhood also, but probably healthier sleeping on the streets than staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay if you don't venture into the neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: jmrrdaniel
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice, comfortable. The staff and restaurant service were excellent. Very helpful. We needed to venture across the street to the grocery store and laundromat, however. Being a blonde, non-Spanish speaking, Caucasian, I was more than a little uncomfortable in my surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DSchmidtNekoosa_Wi
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel close to the Milwaukee Brewers Spring training ball field. The entire staff was very friendly and very accomodating. When we arrived we had a problem opening the door to our room and a maid saw us having trouble and came over immediately to help. She called maintenance and he arrived within two minutes but was unable to solve the problem. The maid called the front desk and they immediately brought us up keys to a new room. The food in the restaurant was very good even though we only ate breakfast and lunch there. The rooms and bathrooms were clean which is very important to us. We didn't use the outdoor pool but for some reason they built a roof over it which didn't make any sense to me. It's always in the shade which we thought was odd being Arizona. The hotel is not located in the best of neighborhoods and there's not any restaurants nearby except for a McDonalds. One would definitely need a car if staying there for any lenght of time. I thought is was a little pricey for $150.00 but I don't know what other hotels in the area are charging. It's immediately off Interstate 10 so access is very easy to any place in Phoenix. Except for it's location to the Brewers Spring training ballpark I'd probably wouldn't stay there again even though it's very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful treat for us. My husband and I are frequent travelers and would rate this as one of our most enjoyable trips. The staff was extremely friendly (they remembered our names and used them frequently...very rare in this day), they always had suggestions for places to eat and fun things to do in the local area and our room was spacious and clean. The food in the restaurant and in the sports bar was INCREDIBLE. We were in town for the NASCAR race and their sports bar was decorated with NASCAR items and had a real hometown feel. We went swimming and jacuzzi-ing everyday and my husband was able to get his daily walk in using the exercise facility. We had an absolutely wonderful time and would recommend this hotel to any/everyone traveling to the Phoenix area!
